text: The 1914 Washington State football team was an American football team that represented Washington State College during the 1914 college football season. The team competed as an independent under head coach John R. Bender, compiling a record of 2–4. ==Schedule== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col" | Date ! scope="col" | Opponent ! scope="col" | Location ! scope="col" | Score ! scope="col" | Attendance |- ! scope="row" | October 6 | Montana | Away | 0-10 L | NA |- ! scope="row" | October 17 | Oregon | P | 0-7 L | NA |- ! scope="row" | October 24 | Oregon State | Home | 0-7 L | NA |- ! scope="row" | November 7 | Idaho | Home | 3-0 W | 4,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 14 | Whitman | S | 7-6 W | 1,500 |- ! scope="row" | November 26 | Washington | Away | 0-45 L | NA |} ==References== ==External links== *Official game program: Idaho at W.S.C. – November 7, 1914 Washington State Category:Washington State Cougars football seasons Category:1914 in Washington (state)
